multiDeployActions.deploy: Deploy {count, plural, one{this version} other{these # versions}}
multiDeployActions.stop: Stop {count, plural, one{this version} other{these # versions}}
multiDeployActions.limitExceeded: You cannot take action on more than {limit} versions concurrently.

deployableStatus.runningOutdated: This deployment is running with an outdated configuration

editConfigurationTemplateDialog.nameAlreadyInUse: The name is already in use by another template

templateEditor.confirmDeletionOfTemplate: Do you really want to delete this template?

deletionDialog.registryIsUsedByProject: The docker registry {registry} is used by these projects:
deletionDialog.usedRegistryWarningText:
If you delete this registry then those projects will remain in an orphaned state.

They can no longer be deployed or used otherwise until they are assigned to a new registry serving images with the same name.
deletionDialog.confirmDeletionText: Please confirm the deletion of this docker registry by entering its name below. This action cannot be undone.

editDialog.trustInsecureRegistryHint: You should not check this if you are running O-Neko in production. Make sure to install valid and trusted certificates in your registry instead. You also have to make sure that your Kubernetes cluster trusts your registry. Otherwise even setting this option will not help you.
editDialog.registryHasBeenModifiedByAction: Docker Registry {registry} has been {action, select, created{created} deleted{deleted} saved{saved} other{modified}}.

dockerRegistry.trustsInsecureCertificates: O-Neko is configured to trust insecure certificates from this registry.
dockerRegistry.doesNotTrustInsecureCertificates: O-Neko does not trust insecure certificates from this registry.

deletionDialog.registryIsUsedByProject: The helm registry {registry} is used by these projects:
deletionDialog.usedRegistryWarningText:
If you delete this registry then those projects will remain in an orphaned state.

They can no longer be deployed or used otherwise until they are assigned to a new registry serving images with the same name.
deletionDialog.confirmDeletionText: Please confirm the deletion of this helm registry by entering its name below. This action cannot be undone.

editDialog.registryHasBeenModifiedByAction: Helm Registry {registry} has been {action, select, created{created} deleted{deleted} saved{saved} other{modified}}.

deploymentBehaviourInput.manually: Deploy new images only on user request
deploymentBehaviourInput.required: You must set a deployment behaviour

lifetimeBehaviourInput.hint: Choose how long deployed resources should be kept alive after their last deployment

urlTemplatesInput.overwritingInheritedTemplates: You are overwriting the URL templates inherited from the project:

search.label: You can search for projects and versions by their name

createDialog.description:
You are about to define a new namespace in O-Neko. You totally can type in a namespace that already exists in Kubernetes.
If you define a namespace that is not yet existing then it will not be created until a project version using this namespace really is deployed.
createDialog.errorPattern: The name must only contain alpha-numeric lowercase characters and dashes in between.
createDialog.errorMaxLength: The name must be 63 characters or less.

namespace.namespaceAction: The namespace {namespace} has been {action, select, created{created} deleted{deleted} other{modified}}.

deleteDialog.description:
You are about to delete the defined namespace {namespace}. All project versions currently using this namespace will fall back to their default namespace.

This will not remove these namespace from Kubernetes.

Please confirm this deletion by entering the namespace below. This action cannot be undone.

createProjectDialog.importProjectDescription: Import a project from a .json configuration file. You can configure the import in the next steps.
createProjectDialog.importCompleteDescription: The imported project contains {count} configuration templates.
createProjectDialog.enterProjectNameDescription:
Enter a meaningful name for your new project.

The name can be chosen arbitrarily but should be distinguishable from the names of yet existing projects.
createProjectDialog.collidingProjectNameMessage: There is already a project with the name {name}.
createProjectDialog.selectDockerRegistryDescription: All docker images for this project will be picked from the docker registry you select here.
createProjectDialog.enterProjectImageName: Enter the new project's image name
createProjectDialog.enterProjectImageNameDescription: Type in the name of the docker image. This must match the image name as present in the docker registry.
createProjectDialog.errorParsingConfiguration: Error while parsing the configuration file

editProject.dockerRegistryIsRequired: Each project must have a docker registry assigned.

deleteDialog.title: Delete {name}?
deleteDialog.message: Please confirm the deletion of this project by entering the project name below. This action cannot be undone.

service.projectSnackbarMessage: Project {name} has been {action, select, created{created} saved{saved} deleted{deleted} other{modified}}.
service.versionSnackbarMessage: {action, select, deployed{Deployment} stopped{Stopping} other{Modification}} of {name} version {version} has been triggered.
service.multiDeploySnackbarMessage: Triggered {action, select, deployed{deployment} stopped{stopping} other{modification}} of {count, plural, one{one version} other{# versions}}.

editDialog.roleRequired: A role is required for every user.
editDialog.enterValidMail: Please enter a valid email address.
editDialog.verifyPassword: Verify your password by entering it again.

deleteDialog.title: Delete {username}?
deleteDialog.message: Please confirm the deletion of this user by entering the username below. This action cannot be undone.
